page.title: 20LIFE STYLES in THUNDRIDGE
page.content: The Sow and Pigs Public House has been situated on the A10 trunk road out of Ware for five hundred years. It's main trade then was to supply ale to the farm labourers. The name is derived from a past pub game called "My Sow's Pig". The premises are owned by the Benskins brewery and the landlord for the past seventeen years is William Morgan. He runs it with his wife and two sons. He also employs five full time and eight casual part-time workers. He recently extended the buildings and the old foundations were discovered. Mr. Morgan does not regard the "Sow and Pigs" as a 'local' in the sense that it is not located near a built up area. However it does have its regulars and also receives a lot of tourist trade in summer. Its dining room is quick to fill up reflecting its popularity.
